titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Raymond M. Fuoss papers

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, and research files documenting Raymond Fuoss's professional career.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Raymond M. Fuoss Papers (MS 1560). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Raymond Matthew Fuoss was born in Bellwood, Pennsylvania on September 28, 1905. He graduated summa cum laude from Harvard College in 1925 and received his Ph.D. in chemistry from Brown University in 1932, in the course of which he did research in Germany and England. His thesis was on the behavior of electrolytes in non-aqueous solvents. Between 1932 and 1945 he worked for various corporations in the field of science and technology. In 1945 Fuoss joined the faculty of the Yale chemistry department. Shortly thereafter he was named Sterling Professor of Chemistry, which he remained until his retirement in 1974. In the course of his career he wrote many articles on a wide range of subjects in journals of chemistry. His main interests were dielectrics, electrolytes, and polymers, and he was the world's leading authority on electrolyte conductance. He was interested in linguistics and fluent in Italian, Portuguese, Spanish, German, Russian, and French. Fuoss married twice. He had one daughter, Pat, from his first marriage. Fuoss died in 1986.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, and research files documenting Raymond Fuoss's professional career.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series: I. Correspondence, 1944-1984. II. Subject files, 1913-1986. III. Writings, 1934-1985.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is divided into two sections: chronological, and alphabetical by correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by subject, and contains correspondence and records related to Professor Fuoss' professional interests.

did.unittitle: Reviews [of others' articles prior to publication]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is divided into two sections: articles and computer programs. The articles section includes a numbered list of Fuoss' publications in chronological order, correspondence with his publishers regarding certain articles, and reprints, all arranged in chronological order. The computer programs section contains correspondence, personal notes, and other material related to his work with computers.

did.unittitle: List [of articles in numbered, chronological order]
264 [boundary conditions in the theory of the relaxation field]
265 [boundary conditions for the integration of the equation of continuity]
266 [paired ions: dipolar pairs as subset of diffusion pairs]
272 [ion pairing of qatemary salts in solvent mixtures]
273 [conductimetric determination ofthermodynamic pairing constants for symmetrical electrolytes]
274 [ion pairing in solutions of sodium tetraphenylborate]
